page.title: 16The Hertingfordbury Project
page.content: Hertingfordbury School has been one school amongst six taking part in a Hertfordshire Project investigating the use of microcomputers in Primary Schools. The Project, known as The Hertingfordbury Project, was financed jointly by Herts County Council and The Trustees of The Cowper Foundation (who are also the Trustees of Hertingfordbury JMI School). It was inaugurated in January 1984 and was completed in December 1985. The main purpose of the Project was to look at the ways in which children (and teachers) use microcomputers for the purposes of handling information in the Primary School. The main family of programs used were the QUEST family, developed by The Advisory Unit for Computer Based Education.
